Select your cookie preferences
------------------------------

We use essential cookies and similar tools that are necessary to provide our site and services. We use performance cookies to collect anonymous statistics so we can understand how customers use our site and make improvements. Essential cookies cannot be deactivated, but you can click “Customize cookies” to decline performance cookies.  
  
If you agree, AWS and approved third parties will also use cookies to provide useful site features, remember your preferences, and display relevant content, including relevant advertising. To continue without accepting these cookies, click “Continue without accepting.” To make more detailed choices or learn more, click “Customize cookies.”

Accept all cookiesContinue without acceptingCustomize cookies

Customize cookie preferences
----------------------------

We use cookies and similar tools (collectively, "cookies") for the following purposes.

### Essential

Essential cookies are necessary to provide our site and services and cannot be deactivated. They are usually set in response to your actions on the site, such as setting your privacy preferences, signing in, or filling in forms.

### Performance

Performance cookies provide anonymous statistics about how customers navigate our site so we can improve site experience and performance. Approved third parties may perform analytics on our behalf, but they cannot use the data for their own purposes.

Allow performance category

Allowed

### Functional

Functional cookies help us provide useful site features, remember your preferences, and display relevant content. Approved third parties may set these cookies to provide certain site features. If you do not allow these cookies, then some or all of these services may not function properly.

Allow functional category

Allowed

### Advertising

Advertising cookies may be set through our site by us or our advertising partners and help us deliver relevant marketing content. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less relevant advertising.

Allow advertising category

Allowed

Blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of our sites. You may review and change your choices at any time by clicking Cookie preferences in the footer of this site. We and selected third-parties use cookies or similar technologies as specified in the [AWS Cookie Notice](https://aws.amazon.com/legal/cookies/).

CancelSave preferences

Unable to save cookie preferences
---------------------------------

We will only store essential cookies at this time, because we were unable to save your cookie preferences.  
  
If you want to change your cookie preferences, try again later using the link in the AWS console footer, or contact support if the problem persists.

You need to enable JavaScript to run this app.

3.  Building Generative AI Applications using SageMaker JumpStart Foundation Models, HuggingFace, and LangChain
    

Building Generative AI Applications using SageMaker JumpStart Foundation Models, HuggingFace, and LangChain
===========================================================================================================

[

Introduction
============

](#introduction)

Welcome to our hands-on workshop on building generative AI applications using Amazon SageMaker, SageMaker JumpStart, HuggingFace, and LangChain. In this interactive session, you will learn how to harness the power of Generative AI to build solutions for text generation tasks. Towards the end of this workshop, you will become familiar with common AWS and GenAI concepts like - SageMaker JumpStart, How to deploy foundation models on SageMaker Endpoints, LangChain, Be able to invoke Sagemaker Model Endpoints via LangChain, Embeddings, Vector Databases (like FAISS - Facebook Artificial Intelligence Similarity Search), LangChain Chains, Prompts, Semantic Search, RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) design pattern and its importance at level-200. Happy building!

The workshop is broken into distinct labs that use Amazon Sagemaker JumpStart and SageMaker Studio Notebooks:

0.  **Setting Up Your AWS Instructor-Led Lab**: We will start with getting your instructor led workshop set up.
    
1.  **Deploy Foundation Model As Sagemaker Endpoint**: We will walk you through steps to deploy a state-of-the-art foundational model using SageMaker JumpStart.
    
2.  **LangChain Basic Lab**: In this lab, you will invoke your foundation model using LangChain library, learn various concepts like Embeddings, Vector Databases (like FAISS - Facebook Artificial Intelligence Similarity Search), LangChain Chains, Prompts, and Semantic Search - by executing sample code.
    
3.  **LangChain Advanced Lab**: In this lab, you will use the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) design pattern with your deployed large language model (LLM) endpoint to perform question answering tasks on your corpus of data. Text generation using RAG is advantageous because it enables you to retrieve data from outside a foundation model and augment your prompts by adding the relevant retrieved data in context.
    

By the end of this workshop, you will have gained valuable knowledge, insights and hands-on experience to build simple Generative AI Proof of Concept application that leverages Amazon SageMaker, JumpStart, and LangChain. The knowledge will allow you to better understand and appreciate one of the most basic use case every organization will look to deploy as part of their GenerativeAI roadmap.

**Disclaimer** : This is a level-200 lab and does not take into account all aspects of an enterprise solution, namely - scale, security, performance, reliability, etc. An enterprise MLP (minimum lovable product) application would need to account for all such aspects of a well-architected AWS solution. Please work with your Solution Architect and SageMaker Specialist Solution Architect to architect a robust enterprise solution.

![Architecture Diagram](https://static.us-east-1.prod.workshops.aws/104eea74-5ed2-4465-a679-62c9b6a9966f/static/RAG_w_LangChain_and_Sagemaker.png?Key-Pair-Id=K36Q2WVO3JP7QD&Policy=eyJTdGF0ZW1lbnQiOlt7IlJlc291cmNlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9zdGF0aWMudXMtZWFzdC0xLnByb2Qud29ya3Nob3BzLmF3cy8xMDRlZWE3NC01ZWQyLTQ0NjUtYTY3OS02MmM5YjZhOTk2NmYvKiIsIkNvbmRpdGlvbiI6eyJEYXRlTGVzc1RoYW4iOnsiQVdTOkVwb2NoVGltZSI6MTcwMzEyNzM0MH19fV19&Signature=IeKlivaVwoTu9o9%7EI6V5a1Sq4liZHvd7-Chyyav4Wt4-k2Z9yYtqxrI6nqHMnswUEqjAvbEtU4sY86aHIAam-jY%7EudEsuCx-%7Et-YlM9b7gKnQmA-GbJFpNxwuJUOuA%7ELmzYkTR6ed3bZ5DhzZJCOleXFwskyA2v8Sso3YrraKeNu-X-ERlk2mhGO1xDIPf9MGXSL-jcKu9wbooJ9MIE34koAoP5boFt%7EwBwJNsQuAkDeYP8yQszUjDVb1sfnWxuu%7ET6l9z6bswQDauN8alia7cgj19ddbcRaniM6AfKEtBdgbSgLz03gK1mAdbK2nAsU5isy7oJrktFno7wEzFyaeA__)

This is a 200-level workshop, so some knowledge of Jupyter notebooks and basic Python scripting would be helpful as your review the cells and execute code. No AI/ML experience is necessary. This workshop is intended to be finished within 4 hours.

[

### Disclaimers

](#disclaimers)

Note: This workshop is intended to be run only at AWS events, you can follow along with your own account by [deploying](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/cfn-console-create-stack.html)  this cloudformation template, but it will incur costs (ballpark around $30).

Event information
-----------------

### During the event

Follow the steps in the workshop guide using your own or a Workshop Studio provided AWS account.

### Workshop Studio provided AWS accounts

You may be provided with a pre-provisioned AWS account for use during the event. The IAM role that we have provided has limited permissions, which will restrict you to the services and API calls required for the event. These accounts are temporary and access will be revoked after the session, at which time all resources will be deleted.

### Ways to access your Workshop Studio provided account

There are a couple ways to access the provided AWS account.

*   Federated login link: A one-click login to the AWS console. Use the `Open AWS console` link under the main side navigation `AWS account access` section.
*   AWS CLI credentials: Shell environment variables needed to make API calls using the AWS CLI. Use the `Get AWS CLI credentials` link under the main side navigation `AWS account access` section.
*   EC2 SSH key: SSH key pair required to access an Amazon EC2 instance provisioned for the event. Use the `Get EC2 SSH key` link under the main side navigation `AWS account access` section.
